summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 regarding the scheduling of a visit for Ghislaine Maxwell to review an FBI laptop at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The emails involve coordination between Maxwell's defense attorney, Assistant United States Attorneys, and FBI Special Agents. The visit, originally scheduled for Friday, October 30, 2020, was ultimately canceled by Maxwell's attorney.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who emails to schedule a visit for his client, Ghislaine Maxwell, to review an FBI laptop at the MDC.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: AUSA in the Southern District of New York who is coordinating the logistics of the FBI laptop review visit at the MDC.

persons.name: Lara
persons.context: AUSA in the Southern District of New York who is copied on the email chain regarding the FBI laptop review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused individual for whom her attorney is scheduling a visit to review evidence (an FBI laptop) while she is detained at the MDC.

connections.description: Everdell is acting as defense counsel, scheduling a visit for Maxwell to review evidence.
Prosecutor and defense attorney coordinating on a procedural matter regarding evidence review.
Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York working on the same case.

events.title: Scheduled FBI Laptop Review at MDC
events.description: A visit was scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell to review an FBI laptop for a 3-hour window at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

events.title: Cancellation of FBI Laptop Review
events.description: Maxwell's attorney notified the prosecution that the scheduled visit for the following day to review the FBI laptop was canceled.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team was actively reviewing evidence, specifically an FBI laptop, while she was in custody in October 2020.

The scheduling involved coordination between Maxwell's defense attorney (Christian Everdell), Assistant U.S. Attorneys (Alison and Lara), and FBI Special Agents from the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit.
A scheduled evidence review visit for October 30, 2020, was canceled by Maxwell's attorney on October 29, 2020.
The emails highlight the procedural aspects of pre-trial evidence discovery and review in a high-profile case.
